title: Survey planning is a resource-oriented activity that should take advantage of in-house and external expertise, best practices, recommendations from the literature, and well-founded quality guidelines

good reasons for not doing so. Guidelines are developed between aspects of design that are considered important and those considered less important regarding the effects on product quality. Quality guidelines have been issued by a number of organizations, including Statistics Canada
The latter agency combines statistical standards and guidelines into a single document. Following is an example of the subject “achieving acceptable response rates

Christopher Skinner A complete list of the titles in this series appears at the end of this volume

Christopher Skinner The Wiley Series in Survey Methodology covers topics of current research and practical interests in survey methodology and sampling. While the emphasis is on application, theoretical discussion is encouraged when it supports a broader understanding of the subject matter. The authors are leading academics and researchers in survey methodology and sampling
